title: Energy of a simple harmonic oscillator - PE

content.question: A block attached to a horizontal spring undergoes simple harmonic motion. The total mechanical energy of the block-spring system is <math alttext="2 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>. At a particular instant, the block has a kinetic energy of <math alttext="0.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>. What is the potential energy of the block-spring system at this instant?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="1.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.0 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.5 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
